channel.title: CVE Feed for openfga -- all
channel.description: The latest CVEs for openfga -- all

item.title: CVE-2024-23820|2024-01-26T16:37:27.065Z -- openfga -- openfga
item.description: OpenFGA, an authorization/permission engine, is vulnerable to a denial of service attack in versions prior to 1.4.3. In some scenarios that depend on the model and tuples used, a call to `ListObjects` may not release memory properly. So when a sufficiently high number of those calls are executed, the OpenFGA server can create an `out of memory` error and terminate. Version 1.4.3 contains a patch for this issue.

item.title: CVE-2024-31452|2024-04-16T21:40:58.856Z -- openfga -- openfga
item.description: OpenFGA is a high-performance and flexible authorization/permission engine. Some end users of OpenFGA v1.5.0 or later are vulnerable to authorization bypass when calling Check or ListObjects APIs. You are very likely affected if your model involves exclusion (e.g. `a but not b`) or intersection (e.g. `a and b`). This vulnerability is fixed in v1.5.3.
